job_title: Emergency Department RN in Sulphur Springs, TX

pros: Meeting a few good people/colleagues.
cons: Trust me working in their lab is like working in a sweat shop. Working here gave me a mental health disorder. Their clinical laboratory has the worst management and only think about themselves, more so, they have an inflated sense of self. They will make you think you're appreciated by sending you kudos points but ultimately will say awful things behind your back. The workload to employee ratio is TERRIBLE. You will be overworked, but terribly underpaid. Their turnover rate is incredibly high and people never stay. ZERO career advancement opportunities. Benefits are ok. Compensation? Let's not even talk about it. This place has very low diversity. And the work life balance is mediocre.

pros: Good coworkers and u learn a lot
cons: Severely understaffed and underpaid. I don’t miss it

pros: Not sure there are any pros
cons: Revolving door, unable to keep staff, no one is held accountable, bad management, underpaid

pros: The people you meet along the way. And the benefits are nice.

pros: It was a broad experience to open doors to other opportunities.  It was a faith-based institute.  I think it's great that they started the service excellence award before I left.  It was always nice when there was an admit/discharge nurse on the floor or at least a halo nurse to help out.
cons: I feel that techs should have been pushed more to do their jobs and offer help to others during their idle times.  The nurses all seemed to have this attitude, but the techs did not. I also feel that support should be given to employees after one of their patients passed.  It was like the next words were, "You're getting an admit when this room is empty." I feel that when mistakes are made, everyone should be made aware so they will learn from someone else's mistake rather than make that mistake on their own.  I think employees should always be told why something is done rather than just being told to do something.  This will make them more likely to do something.  I feel that nurses should not be pushed so much to work overtime missing out on times with their own families.  I would offer partial overtime shifts.

job_title: Student Nurse Extern in Tyler, TX

review_title: Poor treatment of Midlevel Practitioners, miserable work environment!
pros: Decent benefits, decent pay but only with bonus. Nice office space and patient rooms. That is all I can come up with that is positive.
cons: Micromanaged by non-clinical managers that make decisions that greatly affect ability to provide good patient care. Ignore input of PAs/NPs and treat you like a trained monkey they control and allow physicians to dump unwanted, complicated, or time consuming patients on you. They micromanage day to day operations like schedules even when your production is good. There is an incessant amount of meetings about more work they will be piling on you on an almost weekly basis. Force you to work with an inadequate number of brand new, green, poorly trained, underpaid support staff because of high turnover rate. They do not spend enough time training them on EMR or making sure they can adequately assist you before letting them loose forcing you to train them for even simple tasks. This severely affects ability to give timely patient care. Focus more on numbers, scores, QA percentages than actual individualized pt care. They force you to see abusive drug seeking, rude, demanding patients and allow them  to abuse clinicians and support staff.

job_title: Certified Medical Assistant in Tyler, TX
pros:
Working with children
Providers 
Bonding with patients 
Flexibility
cons:
Pay 
The lies that were told as to why I was being paid so little. At my one year evaluation my MANAGER asked me if I was certified. I found this odd to be asked this after working for an entire YEAR! I was asked to bring in my certification again, after already giving this information to the manager at my interview and it was also given to HR. I was told that it was because i was not certified that i was making less than $12.00 an hour. After turning in all my information to management AGAIN, and them seeing I was infact certified it was then changed to the fact I had no experience in the medical field. Which was another way to try and cover their mess because I infact did have experience as a caregiver prior to my employment with them! I did stay another year because I loved what I did and I loved working with “my babies”. Also the PNP I worked for was amazing and I learned a lot from working with her. And no matter if I was being done wrong by the company “my patients” nor the provider deserved mistreatment or for me to just walk out.
Being lied to during the interview process 
MANAGEMENT!!
Employees does not matter to them.

job_title: Family Nurse Practitioner in Tyler, TX
pros: great coworkers, lots of PTO
cons: focus on numbers rather than patient care

pros: Friendly staff and helpful team
cons: I do not have any cons at this moment.

review_title: Terrible place for Advanced Practice Providers
pros: Pay is decent. Most of the nurses are good.
cons:
This health system does not respect PAs or NPs at all.  We are just the little minions that the physicians dump on.  Our opinion means nothing.  Every other hospital I've ever come in contact with treated APPs as professionals and included them in physician/provider decisions.  Not TMF!  They don't include us in anything, because they don't know what to do with us.  Nor are they interested in learning what to do with us.

I have never been somewhere that a physician refused to speak with me simply because I am a PA.  That happens on a regular basis at TMF.  Too many physicians with God complexes, and too many administrators and executives who care more about their salary, bonuses and looking good to everyone else than they do about patient care.

pros: Trinity Mother Frances is a great hospital.  They have the latest technology with computers in all of the rooms for nurse's to document.  They are transitioning so that the nurses also carry iPhones which makes communication easier.  They are also working on becoming magnet status, which is great.
cons: No weekend differential.  There is a high turn over rate.  New grads get hired and then get their experience and leave.  They should pay holiday pay for all required holidays.  The company doesn't appreciate their nurses.  Every year their holiday gift and dinner gets cheaper and cheaper.  This is no way to keep or show that you value nurse's with experience.

pros: None. Management is horrible! More like a play school. Texting, personal phone calls on co phones and cell phones, Internet use for personal things on hospital equipment, all in front of patients and mgmt. management does nothing. The employees that stick to the rules and work hard to be the best they can be for the clinic are treated like outsiders and management looks for any little reason to write them up. Management plays also. Personal calls and texts when they need to be available for employee concerns. No communication between mgmt. and employees. Horrible environment to work in. High employee turnover rate.
cons: Just having to go in each day to that environment knowing management could care less if you are there or not. I had to leave a star rating because of this site but I would give it no stars.

job_title: Office Assistant II in Lindale, TX
pros:
My experience was that the majority of my managers and directors were Great.  They listened to their employees and genuinely tried to improve the work experience and environment so that we had what we needed to do our job well and joyfully.
Team work always encouraged,
cons:
My motto Take care of your employees and they will take care of you. 
Meetings and some safety stuff seemed geared towards the hospital, would be nice if there were more site or clinic based info, while it is one system they are separate entities.

pros: Really good coworkers overall but there are a lot of cliques and favoritism that goes on.It can be who you know.
cons: It is the not same a lot of things have changed and not for the better.  There are departments that are not making it and its just not the same. Nursing has really changed and many nurses are gone plus managers also. The CNO left and so did many of the other leaders. Its hard to know who to trust anymore.

review_title: There is a reason they can't keep leadership or employees. RUN, don't walk away.
pros: The friendliness of the people at Mother Frances are the main redeeming feature.  Everyone is friendly, from the cafeteria on up.
cons: As a leader, the staffing for my department they provided was abysmal.  There was absolutely no way to practice at the level that was needed with the staffing they allowed.  When working on the budget,  I had ample proof of the need for more staff,  but was denied.  Leadership routinely must work as staff in addition to all the meetings, reports and administrative duties, etc. There were multiple times where I was in meetings, but called by my department to handle something only I could handle, because there was no one I could train that had the ability/education to handle those types of problems.  You cannot be in two places at once.  Human Resources upper management is dismissive, although the business partners were helpful when needed.  While I was there, my fellow leaders in other units exited on a monthly basis.  New hires are largely graduating students that just want experience, and generally go with the first institution that makes an offer. Then after a year or two, they leave for more pay and better opportunities.  Even long-time nurses there finally gave up and left for higher salaries-they told me this when they resigned.   Overall, the people in the Executive Suites have unrealistic expectations, and turnover continues.  The message relayed to leaders was that budget tightening would get worse, not better.    The CHRISTUS merger affected everything negatively, it went downhill after that.  Our old Mother Frances culture was lost.

pros: Mother Frances is extremely patient oriented.  It's a wonderful place to work, a better place to heal.  People outside of management tend to work towards a common goal of patient care.
cons: Direct supervisors tend to blame others.  They tend to have favorite employees and different rules for the favorite, and themselves.  They constantly tell you to perform duties you are in the middle of doing.

job_title: General Ledger Assistant in Tyler, TX
pros: This office does its best to make the most out of a job that is normally overworked and underpaid and perfect if you love numbers, pivot tables, and excel spreadsheets. The compensation is more than fair and since you work for a hospital the health insurance coverage is AMAZING!!! The employers make sure to let you know that those who work in this department are a team as well as a family. They are very understanding of your own families needs as well. I have never personally worked under a better boss and along with a great company, you really have a wonderful job
cons: This is a very solitary position and not good for people that need social interaction at work to be happy. Normally you are working at a desk for a constant 8 hours a day looking at numbers and have very limited face to face interaction with your fellow employees. It is a high stress, constantly changing environment and you really need to love to work to have this job since between the 1st through the 10th the monthly closing of the previous months books and it can be difficult to take time off during this time. Even with that this is still the best job and boss i have ever had.

review_title: Many learning opportunities, lots of advanced technology, state of the art facilities.
pros: Could be a great place for professional growth and development. Many resources available to staff and employees.
cons: Upper management had big business "corporate" one size fits all mentality. Corners are cut to save money, medical professionals are spread too thin. Lots of learning opportunity within the system since merger.

job_title: Patient Admissions Representative in Tyler, TX
pros: Loved the organization and the patients. Real effort to make the physical environment pleasant. Great food for patients and staff and visitors.
cons: Never enough representatives to do the work. Someone always in training, out sick/injured, on time off or vacation. This was in 2001. Need increased beds. Patients have to wait hours for a room (present day.)

review_title: Please take the mission statement to include the employees!
